triples.name: E-participation
triples.relevance: The paper examines participatory technologies as mechanisms for citizen engagement in government decision-making.

triples.name: Opinion poll
triples.relevance: Survey experiments are used as the primary methodology to measure political attitudes and approval ratings.

triples.name: Participatory democracy
triples.relevance: The paper investigates how participatory technologies contribute to democratic participation and citizen voice.

triples.name: Political efficacy
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that participation opportunities affect citizens' perception of voice and influence over government.

triples.name: E-government
triples.relevance: Direct Line is a specific e-government platform for citizen participation that the paper empirically tests.

triples.name: Design of experiments
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using survey experiments as a novel research design to test causal effects of participatory technologies.
